thread.title: How did Hawaii tourism do in Latin American and Japan?
thread.title_full: How did Hawaii tourism do in Latin American and Japan?

author: eTN Editor
title: How did Hawaii tourism do in Latin American and Japan?
text:
Rated by eTN Readers - and not for sale! Hotels - Airlines - CVBs - Destinations - people How did Hawaii tourism do in Latin American and Japan? Adv: 
Jun 30, 2015 Adv: 
The Hawaii Tourism Authority has released two market update videos today on Latin America and Japan. These videos include travel trend insights, upcoming in-market promotions, and opportunities to partner for the remainder of 2015. 
Latin America 
Total arrivals to the Hawaiian Islands from Latin America (Argentina, Brazil, Mexico) are down 5.5 percent with 11,419 visitors year-to-date through May 2015. For more information on the Latin America market and what Hawai'i Tourism Latin America has planned in the second of the 2015 to increase arrivals from this region, click on the video here. 
Japan 
Both air seats (-6.9% to 798,365) and arrivals from Japan (-2.1% to 569,606 visitors) are down through May 2015. A major factor is the strengthening of the U.S. dollar, which also contributed to the 13 percent decrease in total Japanese visitor expenditures (to $813.2 million, year-to-date). Click here to find out what HTJ is doing in the second half of 2015 to stimulate growth from this mature market.
